description: Bayesian demultiplexing is a fast and accurate agent for demultiplexing reads generated by Illumina sequencers.
name: Bayexer

metadata.abstract: © The Author 2015. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.Demultiplexing is used after high-throughput sequencing to in silico assign reads to the samples of origin based on the sequenced reads of the indices. Existing demultiplexing agents based on the similarity between the read index and the reference index sequences may fail to provide satisfactory results on low-quality datasets. We developed Bayexer, a Bayesian demultiplexing algorithm for Illumina sequencers. Bayexer uses the information extracted directly from the contaminant sequences of the targeting reads as the training dataset for a naïve Bayes classifier to assign reads. According to our evaluation, Bayexer provides higher capability, accuracy and speed on various real datasets than other agents.
metadata.title: Bayexer: An accurate and fast Bayesian demultiplexer for Illumina sequences
